name: Introduction to Archaeology
description: This course provides an overview of the field of Archaeology, including its history, methods, and key concepts.

name: Introduction to Cultural Resource Management
description: This course introduces students to the field of Cultural Resource Management (CRM) and its role in Archaeology, including CRM laws and regulations, and the ethical considerations of CRM.

name: Archaeological Field Methods
description: This course covers the practical aspects of fieldwork in Archaeology, including survey, excavation, and data management.

name: Archaeological Site Documentation
description: This course covers methods for identifying and documenting archaeological sites, including mapping and recording techniques.

name: Archaeological Analysis and Interpretation
description: This course covers the analysis and interpretation of archaeological data, including the use of GIS and other data analysis methods.

name: Cultural Resource Management in Archaeology
description: This course provides an in-depth look at the role of Cultural Resource Management (CRM) in Archaeology, including CRM laws and regulations, and the ethical considerations of CRM.
